description: An attempt at compiling a comprehensive taxonomy of sensors and interaction methods used in interactive installations and creative technology projects

children.description: Direct physical manipulation and contact-based interactions
Physical objects acted on directly and mapped to an output
Sensor types that can detect these direct interactions
Flexible sensors that detect bending and flexing
Variable resistance sensors for position and value input
Digital switches and momentary contact sensors
Force-sensitive resistors and load cells
children.hardware_requirements: analog input, amplifier for load cells

children.description: Motion and orientation sensing via acceleration
Angular velocity and rotation sensing
Magnetic field and compass direction sensing
Rotary encoders and potentiometers for value control
children.hardware_requirements: digital or analog input depending on type

children.description: These can take many forms. They are often touchscreens that feature either Infrared or capacitive sensors that allow for multiple simultaneous touch points. LiDAR can also be used in a similar fashion.

Radio frequency identification and near-field communication for object identification. These can include objects that have RFID or NFC tags in them that are placed on a reader or come into close proximity of a reader.
Sensors for detecting metallic objects or permanent magnets
A partial list of the types of interactions a person can have with a physical object
Detecting folding or bending motions in materials
Linear motion detection and force sensing
children.hardware_requirements: analog input, linear potentiometer or encoder

children.description: Pressure and force-sensitive interactions
children.hardware_requirements: analog input, FSR or load cell amplifier

children.description: Projectile and catching motion detection
Object presence and weight detection
children.hardware_requirements: load cells, pressure sensors, or proximity sensors

children.description: Rotational motion and position sensing
Waving or blowing air on an object
children.limitations: expressiveness and sensing may be limited, santitary concerns depending on usage

children.description: Conscious user interactions virtually mapped to an output
Body movements and gestures detected through observation
Basic human presence and proximity sensing
Floor-based weight and pressure sensing
Infrared thermal imaging for presence detection
Ultrasonic and laser distance measurement
Standard RGB cameras for presence detection
Capacitive proximity and touch detection
Passive infrared motion detection
Light detection and ranging for precise distance and mapping
Cameras that measure distance using time-of-flight of light
Location-based interactions using Bluetooth proximity
Complete body tracking and skeletal analysis
Full skeletal pose and joint tracking systems
Professional motion capture systems
Inertial measurement unit based motion capture suits
children.limitations: drift over time, magnetic interference, cost

children.description: Marker-based optical motion capture systems
children.limitations: line-of-sight required, marker occlusion, setup complexity

children.description: Depth cameras and skeletal tracking libraries
children.limitations: limited range, single user, lighting sensitivity

children.description: AI-based pose estimation and body tracking
Google's framework for multimodal applied ML
children.limitations: requires good lighting, single person focus

children.description: Real-time pose estimation in the browser
Real-time multi-person 2D pose estimation
Locomotion and step detection systems
Wearable or handheld motion sensors
Inertial sensors for movement detection
Floor-embedded pressure sensing arrays for detailed gait analysis
Detailed pressure distribution analysis for individual footsteps
Hand, limb, and skin-based interaction detection
Camera and computer vision-based hand tracking
Detailed finger and hand pose estimation
Google MediaPipe hand tracking solution
Ultraleap hand tracking sensors
Intel depth cameras with hand tracking
Biometric fingerprint identification
Touch and proximity sensing technologies
Muscle electrical activity for gesture control
Wearable gloves with integrated sensors for detailed hand gesture tracking
children.limitations: comfort, battery life, calibration per user

children.description: Smart textiles and fabric-embedded sensing technologies
Various methods of gesture detection
Electromyogram (EMG)-based gesture control armband that detects muscle movements. Now out of production
Electromyogram (EMG)-based gesture control armband that detects muscle movements. Now out of production
EMG based sensors that can be integrated into various wearables
children.limitations: must be attached to the body and carefully calibrated to a specific use and gesture

children.description: mmWave radar sensing devices for very fine movement detection
Finger-worn tap detection device
Miniature radar for touchless gesture interaction
Facial analysis and recognition systems
children.limitations: privacy concerns, lighting conditions, bias issues

children.description: Face detection and tracking algorithms

name.en: Facial Recognition e.g. "That's a particular face"

children.description: Individual face identification systems
children.limitations: privacy concerns, accuracy bias, false positives

children.description: Emotion and expression detection from facial features
Various algorithms for facial landmark detection and tracking
Eye tracking and gaze detection systems
children.limitations: individual calibration, head movement, glasses interference

children.description: Eye gaze direction and point-of-regard detection
Professional eye tracking systems
Biometric identification using iris patterns
children.limitations: cost, contact lenses interference, lighting requirements

children.description: Monitoring pupil size changes for cognitive and emotional state detection
children.limitations: lighting control required, individual variation, medication effects

children.description: Speech and audio-based interaction systems
Speech recognition and natural language processing
children.limitations: accent sensitivity, noise interference, internet dependency

children.description: Basic audio analysis of volume and pitch
Machine learning-based audio classification
children.limitations: training data requirements, computational needs, context dependency

children.description: Detection of various sound sources and acoustic events

These are interactions that the body tends to perform involuntarily and can be sensed more passively. They tend to require something touching or attached to the body and are considered different than the category for Observed and Active actions.
Biometric and physiological sensing systems
EEG and brain-computer interface technologies
children.limitations: noise susceptibility, individual variation, training required

children.description: Electrical activity of the brain measurement
children.limitations: movement artifacts, setup time, individual calibration

children.description: Electromyography - muscle electrical activity
children.limitations: skin preparation required, crosstalk between muscles

children.description: Heart electrical activity monitoring
Consumer EEG headsets for emotion detection
children.limitations: limited electrode count, dry electrodes less accurate

children.description: EEG sensors and brain-computer interface solutions
Cardiac rhythm and pulse detection
Optical heart rate sensing using light
Video-based heart rate detection using facial analysis
Wearable heart rate monitoring devices
Specific examples of wrist-worn HR monitors
Breathing pattern and respiratory rate sensing
Ultra-wideband radar for non-contact respiration monitoring
Video analysis for breathing pattern detection
Wearable sensors that detect chest expansion
children.hardware_requirements: stretch sensor, elastic band, analog input

children.description: Airflow and radar-based respiration detection
Phase analysis methods for breathing detection
Direct breath flow and composition sensing
Body and ambient temperature sensing
Thermal imaging specifically for facial temperature monitoring
Skin conductance and emotional arousal measurement
children.limitations: skin preparation, individual variation, motion artifacts

children.description: Chemical and olfactory sensing systems
Carbon dioxide concentration measurement
Indoor air quality monitoring sensors
Various electronic nose and chemical sensing technologies
Ambient environmental condition monitoring
Relative humidity measurement
Ambient light intensity measurement
Ambient sound level measurement
